column6: 2015 send card. norris richard pelloquin died on wednesday
column8: 2015 at 1:00pm in a local care facility following a brief battle with cancer. richard was born in lake charles
column10: 1947 to norris and nora pelloquin. a life-long resident of southwest louisiana
column11: he graduated from la. grange senior high school in 1965 and went on to serve his country in the united states naval reserve from 1966 until 1968 as a chaplains assistant aboard the aircraft-carrier uss boxer. upon returning home he attended mc. neese state university where he earned a business degree in 1974. shortly thereafter
column12: he began work as a machinist at citgo petroleum and was employed in various capacities there until his retirement as a purchasing agent in 2004 after nearly thirty years of service. as a proud and devoted credit union member and volunteer for over 35 years
column13: richard was a passionate advocate for the credit union movement. he served on various committees of the cit-con credit union and continued that service after their merger with cse federal credit union in 1982. in 1986 he was elected to the cse board of directorsa position he was most honored to have held and one which he dutifully and enthusiastically fulfilled until his death. he held his colleagues at cse in the highest esteem and considered them all to be among his closest personal friends. richard was an excellent cook and truly enjoyed sharing that skill with others especially his family
column15: and acquaintances. as a dedicated member of st. michael and all angels episcopal church
column16: he regularly helped prepare and serve sunday breakfasts to the congregation there as an original member of the roosters breakfast team. in his spare time
column19: listening to his much-loved cajun music
column20: spending time with his family and friends
column23: watching lsu and the saints win. he was a loving father and grandfather
column25: and a man of exceptionally strong moral character. he will be sorely missed and always fondly remembered by all who knew and loved him. he is preceded in death by his parents
column30: all of lake charles. survivors include his wife of twenty-three years
